header_summary:
SeedHammer is developing a new descriptor format for metal engraved backups, utilizing PSBT binary encoding to create a standard yet compact descriptor, in line with Bitcoin Improvement Proposals BIPs 380-386 and BIP 389. Their method, which aims to be Miniscript-compatible, includes a self-referential system with metadata embedded through PSBT map entries but limits certain expressions and inline keys.

The community is divided on using CBOR versus PSBT for encoding, with Blockchain Commons favoring the established CBOR, while SeedHammer advocates for PSBT based on its simplicity and existing wallet support. Moreover, discussions are ongoing on whether to introduce this new format with a distinct header or as an extension to the existing PSBT framework.

SeedHammer is actively soliciting community feedback on their development to enhance their proposal before formalizing it through the BIP process. They have provided extensive resources, including a detailed proposal, an implementation guide, and an interactive playground, accessible via the provided links: [proposal], [implementation], and [playground].

recent_posts.title: A proposal for a "PSBT for descriptors" format
recent_posts.summary:
- SeedHammer is creating a metal backup descriptor using PSBT binary encoding.
- The format aligns with BIPs standards and supports Miniscript, barring inline keys.
- Debate exists on using CBOR versus PSBT and whether to extend PSBT with a header.

active_posts.title: Ordinals BIP PR
active_posts.summary:
- The sender is seeking feedback on the Ordinals BIP PR, feeling ignored by the editors.
- They clarify that BIPs serve as technical documentation, not indicating community consensus.
- A response is requested to understand the BIP's scope and required changes for acceptance.

active_posts.title: Purely off-chain coin colouring
active_posts.summary:
- Casey Rodarmor's ordinals track satoshis to create non-fungible tokens on the Bitcoin network.
- Inscriptions in the "ord" tool associate data with ordinals, with potential for off-chain storage.
- Coloured bitcoins are inevitable, posing challenges that need addressing rather than avoidance.

active_posts.title: HTLC output aggregation as a mitigation for tx recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency (covenants)
active_posts.summary:
- HTLC output aggregation can mitigate transaction recycling and slot jamming in channels.
- This technique consolidates HTLCs into one output, improving chain efficiency and reducing jamming risks.
- Further development of covenant primitives is required to fully implement HTLC aggregation.

active_posts.title: Lightning Address in a Bolt 12 world
active_posts.summary:
- Proposed enhancements to lightning address protocol seek better privacy and security.
- DNS `TXT` records could link domains to nodes, allowing private retrieval of `node_id`.
- Author suggests adopting two out of three design options for simplicity, awaiting community feedback.

active_posts.title: Liquidity Ads: Updated Spec Posted, please review
active_posts.summary:
- Liquidity Ads spec updated in core-lightning v0.10.1, using CLTV for leasor fund locks.
- Variable lease terms introduced, channel fee caps and increments adjusted for flexibility.
- Proposal includes fraud proof mechanism with ongoing discussions on enforcing fee cap commitments.

active_posts.title: HTLC output aggregation as a mitigation for tx recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency (covenants)
active_posts.summary:
- HTLC output aggregation may enhance efficiency and security, enabling spenders to claim their share.
- Slot jamming could be mitigated by using aggregated outputs, eliminating per-HTLC allocations.
- Development of new covenant primitives and exploration of PTLCs are necessary for implementation.

today_in_history_posts.title: The Excessive-Block Gate: How a Bitcoin Unlimited Node Deals With Large Blocks
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Unlimited is gaining support for solving the block-size limit issue.
- Peter R’s article details the excessive-block logic from a node's perspective.
- A follow-up article will explain the organic development of network-scale block limits.
today_in_history_posts.combined_summary:

- Discussions also involved the proof-of-work's role in extending blockchain length and minimizing deep forks.
- Proposals include transparently advertising block size preferences in coinbase transactions for clarity.
